title: Bug 120922 - "Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description:
Bug 120922 - "Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement

Other pages cannot be used until the source is saved. And then the user needs to figure out how to save or discard their changes. The dialog is titled "Error".

If you edit the XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor and then try to switch back to the Layout view, you will get an error message indicating that you need to save your changes. This problem is that the user has to figure out what they need to do to save the changes (or discard them, which is even harder), and the error message is unclear. The error message is "Source page is dirty."
OB: When editing the XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor and switching back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed stating that the changes need to be saved. The error message states "Source page is dirty."
EB: The software should provide clear instructions on how to save or discard changes made in the XML source view of the Layout Editor. The error message should clearly indicate the action the user needs to take.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Open the XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor.
2. Make some changes to the XML.
3. Try to switch back to the Layout view.

The error message stating that the changes need to be saved should be displayed.
